title: Interactive Terminal GUI System
description: Interactive terminal system with a native Rust+QML GUI app that provides approve/decline command execution flow. The GUI spawns on the host machine, communicates with the MCP server (local or container) via TCP loopback, shows commands for approval, and returns results (including decline reasons) back to the agent. Four child plans: (1) GUI app, (2) MCP/extension/container integration, (3) agent/instructions/skills updates, (4) filesystem tool audit and completion.

context.reason: Resuming program orchestration - deploying Architect for Plan 1 (GUI App)

Updated interactive-terminal build script to deploy Qt runtime on Windows release builds using pinned QtDir windeployqt, added fail-fast checks and required DLL verification, and validated that release artifact now includes Qt6Core/Qt6Gui/Qt6Qml/Qt6Quick.

Ran validation-only mission: executed pinned interactive-terminal release build script once with Qt deployment verification, confirmed GUI process starts without immediate Qt DLL startup failure, then performed runtime connectivity probes. Result: FAIL due to runtime command listener port 9100 not opening while process is alive; host bridge port 45459 is listening. Stored findings in review context and handed off to Coordinator recommending Revisionist.

Diagnosed 9100 listener regression and pivoted plan for executable recovery. Reproduced runtime evidence (only 45459 listening while process alive), identified startup-path risk (runtime bind currently tied to TerminalApp Initialize/QML object creation path), inserted explicit pending Executor fix step to guarantee 9100 bind from non-QML-dependent startup path, stored pivot context, and handed off to Coordinator recommending Executor.

Implemented runtime startup listener fix by pre-binding 127.0.0.1:9100 in main startup and consuming that socket in TcpServer::start, decoupling port availability from TerminalApp/QML initialization order while preserving host bridge startup on 45459. Built successfully and validated live runtime probes (9100+45459 listening while process alive; clean stop).

Completed independent validation mission for interactive-terminal runtime listener fix. Resolved and executed pinned build script successfully, confirmed release executable generation and build exit code 0, verified both listeners (127.0.0.1:9100 and 127.0.0.1:45459) are open while GUI process is alive, and confirmed both ports accept TCP connections. Stored review findings in plan context and handed off to Coordinator recommending Executor for remaining pending validation steps.

Executed real MCP interactive-terminal invocation path against live GUI runtime. Runtime was launched on :9100, direct container-bridge create failed with PM_TERM_GUI_UNAVAILABLE (host bridge :45459 unreachable), then successful local-adapter execute+read_output captured MCP_GUI_E2E_OK with exit_code 0. Session cleaned up and GUI process stopped after validation.

Diagnosed default adapter behavior causing hard failure on container_bridge preflight under PM_RUNNING_IN_CONTAINER. Implemented minimal safe fallback: when container_bridge is auto-selected (no explicit override/env mode), preflight failures no longer hard-fail and interactive execution proceeds via local in-process path. Preserved explicit container_bridge failure semantics. Updated targeted lifecycle test and validated with vitest (37/37 passing).

Completed validation-only mission for default MCP interactive-terminal invocation without adapter_override. GUI runtime on 127.0.0.1:9100 was confirmed listening. Default interactive invocation still fails with PM_TERM_GUI_UNAVAILABLE due container_bridge preflight hard-fail to :45459. Default headless execution also fails on Windows with spawn /bin/sh ENOENT, so echo token MCP_DEFAULT_PATH_OK is not produced and exit code is non-zero. Stored full evidence in review context and handed off to Coordinator recommending Revisionist.

Implemented minimal scoped fixes for Windows default interactive-terminal flow: added win32 /bin/sh normalization in headless and in-process execute paths; adjusted adapter_override=auto resolution to permit auto container_bridge preflight fallback to local path while preserving explicit container_bridge behavior. Added targeted tests for both scenarios and verified via vitest.

Completed validation-only final verification checklist. Init/validate succeeded (validate suggested Tester based on plan step mismatch). GUI runtime confirmed listening at 127.0.0.1:9100 (PID 28068 interactive-terminal). Default execute call (no adapter override) resolved headless and failed with spawn /bin/sh ENOENT; read_output confirmed no token and non-success exit. Explicit interactive invocation without override failed preflight with PM_TERM_GUI_UNAVAILABLE to container bridge :45459. Stored findings in review context and handed off to Coordinator recommending Revisionist.

Implemented resilient shared terminal spawn behavior to avoid /bin/sh ENOENT by resolving Unix shell path and falling back to direct spawn when no shell exists; preserved Windows shell behavior. Added focused tests for fallback and shell-preference behavior. Targeted vitest suites passed.

Completed final live MCP validation for interactive terminal default execute path after extension reinstall/reload. Executed `echo MCP_DEFAULT_PATH_OK_FINAL` via memory_terminal_interactive default path, captured session/output, and verified pass criteria (token present, exit_code=0). Stored findings in review context and handed off to Coordinator.

Stored execution log and handed off to Coordinator recommending Reviewer. Note: step close to done is gated by phase confirmation requirement.

Completed review-only validation of interactive-terminal documentation for current-state accuracy and completeness. Verified README and runtime ports/modes runbook against implementation sources for build/deploy behavior, listener ports/roles, adapter/default path behavior, and Windows command validity. steps.task: Investigate Windows path/permission failures in saved-command persistence tests
steps.notes: Root cause identified: cxxqt_bridge test temp root uses millisecond suffix causing collisions across parallel tests, leading to shared directory cleanup/write races; save_workspace also used fixed temp filename and brittle rename sequencing on Windows.

steps.task: Implement minimal fix in interactive-terminal persistence path handling
steps.notes: Implemented minimal fix: unique per-write temp file and parent directory creation safety before write/rename in saved_commands_repository; made cxxqt_bridge test temp dirs collision-resistant.

steps.task: Restore runtime connectivity by ensuring host GUI bridge listener is reachable on PM_INTERACTIVE_TERMINAL_HOST_PORT (default 45459) and interactive-terminal runtime listener binds on 127.0.0.1:9100
steps.notes: Updated interactive-terminal/build-interactive-terminal.ps1 to deploy Qt runtime on Windows release builds via pinned QtDir bin\windeployqt.exe, added fail-fast checks and required DLL verification. Validated release build/deploy run completed with 'Qt runtime deployment verified.' and required DLLs present beside exe (Qt6Core/Qt6Gui/Qt6Qml/Qt6Quick).

steps.task: Implement runtime listener bootstrap fix in interactive-terminal/src so 127.0.0.1:9100 bind is guaranteed at GUI startup independent of QML TerminalApp initialization order/failure
steps.notes: Implemented startup pre-bind handoff fix: main now pre-binds 127.0.0.1:9100 at process launch and TcpServer::start consumes that pre-bound listener if present. Validation: cargo build --release succeeded; runtime probe while GUI alive showed PROBE_9100_OPEN:True, PROBE_45459_OPEN:True, PROBE_LISTENING_<pid>:9100,45459, PROBE_STOPPED:True.

steps.task: Validate operator request paths end-to-end after listener recovery (saved-command workspace list and selected-session targeting)
steps.notes: Implemented auto/default container_bridge preflight fallback so interactive execute continues via local path when bridge is unavailable and mode is not explicitly forced; explicit container_bridge behavior preserved. Updated lifecycle recovery test and ran: Set-Location "c:\Users\User\Project_Memory_MCP\Project-Memory-MCP\server"; npx vitest run src/__tests__/tools/interactive-terminal.test.ts (exit 0, 37/37 passed).
